message.content:
cs.FL, cs.DS, cs.LO, cs.CC, cs.PL

The paper deals with the complexity of comparing the downward closures of languages, which is a topic related to formal languages and automata theory. Therefore, cs.FL (Formal Languages and Automata Theory) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also involves the study of complexity classes and decision problems, which suggests that it could also belong to cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) and cs.CC (Computational Complexity). The use of completeness results and hardness proofs indicates a connection to logic and proof theory, which could place the paper in cs.LO (Logic in Computer Science). Finally, the paper mentions Petri nets and pushdown automata, which are topics related to programming languages and compilers, suggesting a possible connection to cs.PL (Programming Languages).
